titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Durham County (N.C.) papers, circa 1895-1980s RL.10026
titlestmt.author: Molly Bragg and Carrie Mills

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 15:54:14 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Durham county is a county in northeast central North Carolina. The county was formed in 1881. Collection materials are predominantly arranged in chronological order beginning in 1870. Within the chronology, decades are broken down by subject. Subjects include: activism, art, business, churches, clubs, courts, education, landmarks, minorities, politics, public works, publications, senior citizens, the Watts Hospital, women, YMCA/YWCA. Subject folders contain miscellaneous manuscripts and printed materials, including numerous leaflets, booklets, pamphlets, and maps.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Durham county is a county in northeast central North Carolina. The county was formed in 1881.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection materials are predominately arranged in chronological order beginning in 1870. Within the chronology, decades are broken down by subject. Subjects include: activism, art, business, churches, clubs, courts, education, landmarks, minorities, politics, public works, publications, senior citizens, the Watts Hospital, women, YMCA/YWCA. Subject folders contain miscellaneous manuscripts and printed materials, including numerous leaflets, booklets, pamphlets, and maps. Collection is heavy in Durham Arts Council and related Durham-area arts publications and materials, workers' rights campaigns and African American political mobility. Some parts of the collection are unprocessed. Finding aid represents present ordering of folders, box labels, and box order.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Durham County (N.C.) records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in multiple accessions starting in 1937.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Durham County (N.C.) papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.
